speaker: MAN
line: Ven aqui! Ven aqui! Ven! Aver.

speaker: OTHER MEN
line: Nos debemos irnos y dejarlo en paz. Debemos decirle al anciano. El sabra que hacer. Esto es malo, muy malo. Nos va a traer problemas para todos nosotros.

speaker: BILAC
line: Le tenemos que decir al Doctor Roosevelt. Inmediatamente.

speaker: BILAC
line: Dr. Roosevelt.

speaker: DR. ROOSEVELT
line: What is it?

speaker: BILAC
line: We found something I think you should see.

speaker: DR. ROOSEVELT
line: It's an Amaru.

speaker: BILAC
line: I know.

speaker: DR. ROOSEVELT
line: It's fantastic. It's nearly intact.

speaker: BILAC
line: We can’t take it.

speaker: DR. ROOSEVELT
line: What do you mean?

speaker: BILAC
line: They're saying the body of a female shaman is sacred to the tribe. They won't allow us to disturb her.

speaker: DR. ROOSEVELT
line: We’re not disturbing her. We’re saving her. You know the situation here. I thought you could handle these people.

speaker: BILAC
line: Dr. Roosevelt, I think this is dangerous. I don't think this is right.

speaker: DR. ROOSEVELT
line: Have the piece cleared and packed. It's going with us.

speaker: GUARD
line: Mr. Horning, you still here? Mr. Horning? What the hell...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you learn about what happened here last night?

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: Tim Decker, one of our security guards, called me when he first discovered the blood.

speaker: SCULLY
line: According to the police, you felt this murder may have been an act of political terrorism.

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: I think Craig Horning was killed because of the project he was working on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that the survey and excavation of the uh … "highland burial grounds of the Secona Indians?" This is from a letter that was sent to the State Department on behalf of the Secona demanding the return of a certain artifact.

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: The Amaru Urn. It was among the antiquities we rescued last month.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rescued?

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: When Petroecuadot announced plans to build a gas pipeline through the burial grounds Carl Roosevelt and I organized the dig.

speaker: SCULLY
line: As I understand it, Roosevelt disappeared under circumstances not dissimilar to the ones here.

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: The Ecuadorean government claimed he was carried off in some kind of wild animal attack.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But that’s not what you believe.

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: Not after last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have there ever been any death threats?

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what about the curse? The Secona believe great evil would befall anyone that disturbed the remains of an Amaru, a woman shaman – that they would be devoured by the Jaguar Spirit.

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: A myth that gained some currency among the Secona when Dr. Roosevelt disappeared.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m sure.

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: The unfortunate thing is somebody exploiting it to promote fear, to pressure us into returning the bones which I have absolutely no intention of doing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can we see it?

speaker: DR.LEWTON
line: Yes, of course. Uh, Mona.

speaker: MULDER
line: Personally, if someone digs me up in 1,000 years I hope there's a curse on them too.

speaker: MONA
line: They should have left it buried. None of this would have happened.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you believe the bones are cursed?

speaker: MONA
line: Might as well be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you know Craig Horning?

speaker: MONA
line: Yeah, I've been helping Craig sort and catalog the Ecuadorean artifacts. I'm a PHd. candidate at BU.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he have any warning that this could happen?

speaker: MONA
line: Craig? No. He was so dedicated. He was just doing the work that Dr. Lewton asked him to.

speaker: MULDER
line: He had no political feelings about the piece being brought here?

speaker: MONA
line: No, not Craig.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you aware that a letter of protest was sent to the State Department concerning this urn?

speaker: MONA
line: I’m aware of several letters of protest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This one was written by a man named Alonzo Bilac.

speaker: MONA
line: Dr. Bilac. He was the liaison with the Secona Indians.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is he still with the project?

speaker: MONA
line: No, he either resigned or was forced out by Dr. Lewton depending on who you talk to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why is that?

speaker: MONA
line: Dr. Bilac feels the Secona have the right to determine the fate of their ancestral remains.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know where we might find him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Bilac?

speaker: BILAC
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’re with the FBI. We’re investigating the disappearance of an associate of yours --- Craig Horning.

speaker: BILAC
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: May we ask you some questions?

speaker: BILAC
line: Come in then.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Bilac, you were part of the expedition that brought back the Amaru urn.

speaker: BILAC
line: Who told you that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mona Wustner.

speaker: BILAC
line: I objected from the beginning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you were Dr. Roosevelt's liaison in Ecuador. At what point did you part company with him on the taking of artifacts?

speaker: BILAC
line: When I felt like he had gone too far. Against the wishes of the Secona.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you express that to him?

speaker: BILAC
line: Yes. He wouldn’t listen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Were you speaking for yourself or for the Indians?

speaker: BILAC
line: I spent the last six months living with the Secona, learning from them, coming to understand the nature and the depth of their culture.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, apparently, they’ve learned something from you too.

speaker: BILAC
line: Yes, I've been teaching them the joys of American bureaucracy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Lewton believes that the protest over the Amaru urn has something to do with Craig Horning's disappearance.

speaker: BILAC
line: You say disappearance as if you expect to see him alive again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think happened to him?

speaker: BILAC
line: You don't want to know what I think.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, we would like to know. We'd be very interested in what you think.

speaker: BILAC
line: I think whatever happened to Craig Horning will continue to happen until the bones are returned to their rightful place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let me ask you, Dr. Bilac. How far would you go to defend the rights of the Seconas? Farther than writing a letter to the state department?

speaker: BILAC
line: If you think I did this, then you’re a fool.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you account for your whereabouts last night?

speaker: BILAC
line: I was here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alone?

speaker: BILAC
line: Yes. Your investigation is a waste of time and that's something I can assure you of.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's nice to meet people who really believe in something, isn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean the kind who would kill for their cause?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think Bilac's a suspect?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I think he's *the* suspect.

speaker: MULDER
line: Based on what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Based on the arrogance of his politics, on his rift with Dr. Lewton, on his sympathies towards the Indians. And the lack of any other suspect.

speaker: MULDER
line: He did look a little squirrely back there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe because he was up late murdering Craig Horning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, let me remind you we don't have a body and not much more forensic detail than a lot of spilled blood.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Craig Horning's blood. What do you think he did with him?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure he did anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think Bilac's innocent? That the victim wasn't even murdered at all? That he was devoured by a mythological jaguar spirit?

speaker: MULDER
line: Go with it, Scully.

speaker: MONA
line: Why did you lie to them? … You're only drawing suspicion to yourself by lying, Lonnie. … You should have told them the truth. ….I'm worried about you. …. Let me come over. Why? Why not?

speaker: MONA
line: Dr. Lewton's here. I got to go. I'll call you later.

speaker: DR. LEWTON
line: Thought you'd already left.

speaker: MONA
line: I have, uh...I really need to keep working right now.

speaker: DR. LEWTON
line: I'd feel better if you weren't alone here.

speaker: MONA
line: The guard knows I'm here.

speaker: DR. LEWTON
line: Was that Dr. Bilac on the phone?

speaker: MONA
line: Yes.

speaker: DR. LEWTON
line: We have a responsibility, Mona, to history and posterity. Dr. Roosevelt was only doing what any good conservationist would have done in bringing the Amaru urn back. Otherwise, it would certainly have been destroyed.

speaker: MONA
line: I know.

speaker: LEWTON
line: You know, if we get caught up in the politics we lose sight of that. Mona, let me give you a little free advice. You have a bright future here. Be careful where you plant your flag.

speaker: MONA
line: Oh, Sugar.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Label that.

speaker: OFFICER
line: As what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Partial rat body part.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me Can I have a word with you? You were working here last night when Dr. Lewton was killed.

speaker: MONA
line: He stopped by my office on his way out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you notice anything out of the ordinary? Was he behaving strange or did he seem nervous about anything?

speaker: MONA
line: No, not at all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he say anything to you about Dr. Bilac?

speaker: MONA
line: No, he didn't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any idea when the two of them last spoke to each other?

speaker: MONA
line: I really don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to give you my card. Call me if anything comes to mind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder…

speaker: MULDER
line: They turn up a body?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. They've been over the entire museum grounds. Have you found anything at all out here?

speaker: MULDER
line: If Dr. Lewton was brought through here, it's going to be hard to determine. It looks like it rained pretty hard last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they determined that the hood release had been pulled. They found a small flashlight near the car. Looks to me like he was checking the engine when attacked.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe somebody didn't want that car started.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t think so, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We found evidence of at least two mutilated rat bodies down in the engine compartment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Rats?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apparently, the museum has always had a rat problem. They must have crawled into the engine to keep warm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, Mulder, there's hardly a thing about these deaths that adds up.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s he estimate on the time of death?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Somewhere between 9:30 and midnight when the guard discovered the blood.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's about the same time as Craig Horning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s the connection?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think Mona Wustner might know something.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, she seemed to get nervous when I asked her about Bilac. Maybe she’s trying to protect him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think it’s starting to rain again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t think so, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell is that?

speaker: MONA
line: Lonnie?

speaker: MONA
line: Lonnie?

speaker: BILAC
line: Don’t.

speaker: MONA
line: Lonnie? I came to tell you... Dr. Lewton is dead. Did you hear what I said? Say something, Lonnie, please. You're scaring me.

speaker: BILAC
line: I told you not to come here.

speaker: MONA
line: Why not? What's happened to you? Ever since you came back you're acting like some stranger. Like someone else.

speaker: BILAC
line: The blood has to stop.

speaker: MONA
line: You know something, don’t you?

speaker: BILAC
line: You wouldn’t understand.

speaker: MONA
line: Then help me to understand! You can tell me. You know that, don't you? What is that?

speaker: BILAC
line: Vine of the soul.

speaker: MONA
line: Yahe?! You’re drinking Yahe?!!! You're sick, Lonnie! You need help. Don't you see what's happening here? Can't you see what you're doing to yourself?

speaker: BILAC
line: Go.

speaker: MONA
line: Let me help you.

speaker: BILAC
line: I said GET OUT!!!!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's human. Small intestine. There's about four feet of jejunum and another foot of ileum.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do we know for sure it's Lewton?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, by what he had for lunch. Corn chowder. It looks like he'd been snacking on sunflower seeds all afternoon.

speaker: MULDER
line: A man of taste.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I can't determine how the body was eviscerated. There are no knife marks on the epithelium. I imagine they could have been torn or pulled from the body cavity.

speaker: MULDER
line: Torn or pulled?

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I can't determine that, either, because there was considerable postmortem predation.

speaker: MULDER
line: By what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, by the size of the bite marks, a small animal, most probably a rat.

speaker: MULDER
line: More rats.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yep.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully? …. Slow down, Mona.

speaker: MONA
line: I … I was with Dr. Bilac. He frightened me. I … I thought he was going to hurt me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened, Mona?

speaker: MONA
line: He’s sick. He doesn’t know what he’s doing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he now?

speaker: MONA
line: At his house. I left him there and I came back to the museum. But … I feel like someone’s here. Like someone’s watching me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to stay exactly where you are. I’m going to send Agent Mulder over to get you, right away, okay? He’s on his way.

speaker: MONA
line: Okay.

speaker: MONA
line: What is it Sugar?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Bilac?

speaker: GUARD
line: Oh! What are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looking for Mona Wustner. I got a panicked call from her.

speaker: GUARD
line: From Mona?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, where is she?

speaker: GUARD
line: I'll show you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it’s me. Did you find Mona?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but her car is parked outside. She’s not here. Did you find Bilac?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. He’s not here either. But I found his journals. "I've seen the Amaru coming out of the jungle with the eyes of a scorpion, the claws of a jaguar. She leaps down from the trees. She tears at my flesh, then holds my head in her hands, and eats out my eyes."

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there a date of entry on that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: These are all recent.

speaker: MULDER
line: Read about the jaguar coming down from the trees again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe that’s how the intestines got up there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I think Bilac’s been tripping. I found something strange in a ceremonial bowl and - and from his writings it says that it’s .. it’s a hallucinogen called "Yaje." "The Vine of the Soul."

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell’s that supposed to mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think he's been praying to the Amaru through some kind of a ceremony.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's he want from her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like he's invoking the curse, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I'm going to have to call you back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you find Mona?

speaker: MULDER
line: I hope not.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing here? I said, what are you doing here?

speaker: BILAC
line: She's dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is she?

speaker: BILAC
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You told Agent Mulder that she was dead. You must know where she is.

speaker: BILAC
line: I didn't kill her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why do you have blood on your clothes?

speaker: BILAC
line: I told you. I came here because the Amaru would not be appeased. I was afraid for Mona. I tried to keep her away from all this... She was an innocent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She said she was scared. She said that you became violent.

speaker: BILAC
line: She wouldn’t listen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you were too high to know the difference. There is no curse, is there, Dr. Bilac? You are the curse.

speaker: BILAC
line: No. This is more powerful than any man. This is a spirit you're dealing with-- the spirit of the Amaru. This is not something you can put in handcuffs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m going to ask you one more time, Dr, Bilac, where is Mona’s body?

speaker: BILAC
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That man stays in that room until there's a full search of the museum, okay?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Yes, ma'am.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully! Come here for a second. Just dawned on me. Why do you think there's so much water in here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just assumed that one of the toilets had overflowed.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's water on every seat. It's more like every toilet overflowed. Now, why would that happen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's only one way to find out.

speaker: MULDER
line: I hate this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Rats.

speaker: MULDER
line: In every toilet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did they get in there.

speaker: GUARD
line: Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: GUARD
line: The police found something outside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mona Wustner?

speaker: GUARD
line: No. Sugar – her dog. He’s dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Finally a body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you find?

speaker: VETERINARIAN
line: I have to run a full toxicological to be sure but it looks like warfarin poisoning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Warfarin?

speaker: VETERINARIAN
line: Rat poison.

speaker: MULDER
line: Someone fed this dog rat poison?

speaker: VETERINARIAN
line: No. When I dissected the dog's stomach I found an undigested fragment of intestine which appears to be feline.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The dog ate a cat.

speaker: VETERINARIAN
line: I also found what appears to be bits of rat fur. I think the rat ate the poison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The cat ate a rat.

speaker: MULDER
line: And the dog ate the cat. More rats, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't you think that's significant?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Significant of what?

speaker: MULDER
line: There were rats in Dr. Lewton's car engine. There were rats in the bathroom where it looks like Mona might have been killed and now here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s an old building, Mulder. They have a rat problem. A lot of old buildings have rats.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no. I think it’s more than that. What is it that the Secona believe? That the jaguar spirit will devour anybody that desecrates the burial place of a holy woman. Essentially, they’re talking about transmigration of the soul into animal form achieved through a ceremony where they drink, the uh...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yaje.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. To summon the spirits.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what are we talking here, Mulder, a possessed rat? The return of Ben?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I think those rats were killed trying to escape from something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From something that sent them diving into the toilet.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, the lids were down. They weren’t trying to get into the toilets, they were trying to get out. They were coming from within the sewer lines trying to get away from something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have *you* been drinking Yaje, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Go with it, Scully.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Agent Scully? Bilac’s gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What? How’s that possible?

speaker: OFFICER
line: I don’t know. I went to check on him and he just … wasn’t there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you step away from this door at any time?

speaker: OFFICER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And no one entered this room?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Absolutely not.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about a rat?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Sir?

speaker: MULDER
line: You ever see any rats in this room?

speaker: GUARD
line: All the time. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you think they get in here?

speaker: GUARD
line: Through the old heating system. There are vents all over this place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are there any other doors or windows in this room?

speaker: OFFICER
line: I checked. There’s only one way out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You didn’t hear anything?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Nothing. I heard nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to search the entire building beginning with every room on this floor.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Yes, Ma’am.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, take a look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where does it lead to?

speaker: GUARD
line: The old steam tunnels.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you get down there?

speaker: GUARD
line: They’re pretty much sealed up. Haven’t been used for 50 years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think Bilac crawled down there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless he was dragged.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The system looks like it branches off into three directions. There must be miles of tunneling down there.

speaker: MULDER
line: And only one way in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And one way out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ladies first?

speaker: MULDER
line: Which way?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To the left, it looks like.

speaker: MULDER
line: Follow that rat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We should be directly under the museum here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Scully?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God. It’s Dr. Lewton. It looks like his eyes were eaten right out of his sockets.

speaker: MULDER
line: We still don’t know by what.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think it’s a cat. )

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think that cat killed those people?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, *these* cats. Which way is out?

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, Mulder, this way. There’s a room here with a vent. Up there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s Bilac.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you reach up in there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let’s pull him down.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, I will call you back later.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the search team's on their way back up. They've recovered all the bodies including Mona's and Bilac's.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the cats?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Animal control is still looking. So far, they haven't found any sign of them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we both saw them down there, Scully. We know they’re down there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one’s denying that, Mulder, it’s just that there are miles of tunnels down there. And they’re saying it’s gonna take weeks to search them all.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, by then it won’t even matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I just got off the phone with the Assistant Secretary of State’s office. They’ve called in the Ecuadorean Ambassador.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What for?

speaker: MULDER
line: Five people had to die but they're finally taking it seriously.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The curse?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Bilac's letter of protest. The State Department has asked that the museum remain closed until they can act officially on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are they going to send back the bones?

speaker: MULDER
line: The urn will be back in Ecuador by the end of the week.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Suffolk county coroner ruled the deaths at the museum were the result of animal attacks. What motivated these attacks and why no more have occurred since has not been explained. To the museum, the urn was an artifact from a dying culture-- its curse merely a primitive superstition. Dr. Bilac learned there is a world beyond our own, unseen but powerful, and as real as the urn itself.

speaker: MULDER
line: The icons from that world represent forces that cannot be tamed or collected in a museum. The true curse that struck the museum was the failure to understand that there are powers that should not be disturbed... That some things are better left buried.
